page.title: 02LIVESTOCK TESTING
page.content:
The Meat and Livestock Commission have two establishments in the area. The larger one is involved in research on the content and quality of feed for pigs and the smaller establishment keeps sperm to be used for artificial insemination.
{The Pig Progeny Testing Station}does 6-7 week tests - measuring the quantity and composition of feed. At the end of this time half of the pigs are slaughtered and tests are made on their carcasses. 2500 pigs are taken in per year. There are 4 buildings each holding 220 pigs. A breeder submits 4 pigs for testing (at Â£254 per test). 7 people are employed here.
